bzh.plealog.bioinfo.api.data.feature

Interface Feature

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IFeature

    public interface Feature
extends Cloneable, Serializable
    This class describes a single Feature that can be associated to a sequence. Usually, a Feature is not directly set to a sequence: instead, Features have to be associated to a FeatureTable.
    Author:
    Patrick G. Durand

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        String getKey()
        Returns the key name of the feature.

      • getFrom

        int getFrom()
        Returns the starting position of the Feature on the sequence. Value is one-based.

      • getTo

        int getTo()
        Returns the ending position of the Feature on the sequence. Value is one-based.

      • getStrand

        int getStrand()
        Returns the strand location. See XXX_STRAND constants defined in this class.

      • setKey

        void setKey(String str)
        Sets the key name of this Feature.

      • setStrand

        void setStrand(int i)
        Sets the strand location. Use one of the XXX_STRAND constants defined in this class.

      • setFrom

        void setFrom(int i)
        Sets the starting position of the Feature on the sequence. Value is one-based.

      • setTo

        void setTo(int i)
        Sets the ending position of the Feature on the sequence. Value is one-based.

      • getFeatureLocation

        FeatureLocation getFeatureLocation()
        Returns the feature location description. Use only when a feature location cannot be described with a single from/to pair of values. May return null.

      • setFeatureLocation

        void setFeatureLocation(FeatureLocation fl)
        Sets a FeatureLocation. Use this king of object when a Feature location is described with more than a single from/to pair of values.

      • addQualifier

        Qualifier addQualifier(String name,
                     String value)
        Adds a new Qualifier to this Feature.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Qualifier
        value - the value of the Qualifier
        Returns:
        the new Qualifier created with name and value

      • addQualifier

        void addQualifier(Qualifier q)
        Adds a new Qualifier to this Feature.

      • qualifiers

        int qualifiers()
        Returns the number of Qualifiers contained in this Feature.

      • getQualifier

        Qualifier getQualifier(int i)
        Returns a particular Qualifier.

      • enumQualifiers

        Enumeration<Qualifier> enumQualifiers()
        Returns an enumeration over the Qualifiers contained in this Feature.

      • clone

        Object clone()
        Forces the implementation of a clone method.

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(int hitFrom,
              int hitTo)
        For internal use only.

      • cut

        Feature cut(int from,
          int to)
        Cut a feature given new from and to values. If the feature is out of range given the new coordinates, then this method should return null.

      • spanLeft

        boolean spanLeft()
        Figures out if a feature spans beyond left limit.

      • spanRight

        boolean spanRight()
        Figures out if a feature spans beyond right limit.
